main_definition: To combine or blend two or more entities, typically ideas, organizations, or resources.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In business, to unite companies or assets for operational efficiency and growth.
meanings_and_examples.example: After years of independent operations, Company A and B decided to merge.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In computing, to combine two files into one by combining their contents.
meanings_and_examples.example: The software merged the text from both documents into a single output file.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To incorporate or integrate ideas from different sources in problem-solving or creative processes.
meanings_and_examples.example: When designing the new product, the team sought to merge innovative technologies with traditional methods.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In transportation and logistics, when two vehicles move together on a shared route.
meanings_and_examples.example: The train merged onto the main freight line at the junction station.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To combine different types of media or elements into one piece for artistic expression.
meanings_and_examples.example: The artist decided to merge painting with digital animation in her latest work.
